intro: Schoenoplectus setaceus, commonly known as the slender bulrush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typically blooming in late summer. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense stands in shallow water or moist soil. Schoenoplectus setaceus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
